name.description: The pilot's name, as written on the card itself.

id.description: The pilot's unique id number. It's not used in the game but it's used to link this pilot to other data in this dataset.

unique.description:
Indicates whether this pilot has a unique name or not.
Some pilot cards have unique names, which are identified by the bullet to the left of the name.
A player cannot field two or more cards that share the same unique name, even if those cards are of different types.

anyOf.description: Having '?' as a pilot's skill means that there is a special ruling for it and it's variable.
Having '?' as a pilot's squad points cost means that there is a special ruling for it and it's variable.

slots.description: A list of the slots available to this pilot.

items.description: A slot available to this ship.

text.description: The pilot card's text describing its effect.

image.description: The file path for this pilot card's image.

xws.description: The pilot's unique XWS id as described in the XWS format.

ship_override.description:
Most times, ships attributes remain the same for all its pilot cards.
When they don't, this attribute is used to reflect those changes.
The values here supersede the ones provided by pilot's ship values.

range.description: The ship's range. This property is for huge ships only.
